page.title: 07A DAY AT THE "BERRIES"
page.content:
The piece of ground you pick the tatties from is called a{"bit"}which is about 5m long. For a half bit you get Â£4.50 and a whole bit Â£9.00. At 4.15p.m. the bus comes along and takes all the people home.
In the summer holidays we can go {raspberry}picking. The "berries" start at about 7.30a.m. and finish at 4.00p.m. If you do not caper you should earn about Â£4.00 or Â£5.00 in a day. When you are picking you can either tie your baskets around your neck or around your waist. You get to choose a{"dreel"}and you pick the berries on that row. You are given a crate which holds six individual baskets. When you have filled six baskets you take them to be weighed and for the weight you will receive a certain amount of money.
